name: Uniweb for WP
author: Shohei Tanaka

sections.description:
Web accessibility functions can be easily implemented with plugins.
A wide range of customization is possible without compromising your brand or worldview.
Rich Web accessibility features that support standards.
This plugin integrates with a third party called uniweb that improves the web accessibility of your WordPress site.
A contract with the Uniweb is required.
SoftStepsStudio is an agency that handles Uniewb for WordPress sites.
Please see below for details.
https://studio.ssec.shop/uniweb/?utm_source=wordpressorg&utm_medium=plugins&utm_campaign=normal

Uniweb Privacy Policy
https://hellouniweb.com/privacy-statement/
Terms of service
https://hellouniweb.com/terms-of-service/

How to apply for Uniweb services

If you would like to apply for Uniweb’s services, please check the contents of the page below and apply using the application form.

https://studio.ssec.shop/uniweb/?utm_source=wordpressorg&utm_medium=plugins&utm_campaign=normal
sections.installation:
Automatic installation

Automatic installation is the easiest option — WordPress will handle the file transfer, and you won’t need to leave your web browser. To automatically install Uniweb for WP, log in to your WordPress dashboard, navigate to the Plugins menu, and click “Add New.”

In the search field, type “Uniweb for WP,” then click “Search Plugins.” Once you’ve found us, you can view its details, such as the point release, rating, and description. Most importantly, of course, you can install it! Click “Install Now,” and WordPress will take it from there.

Manual installation

Manual installation requires downloading the Uniweb for WP plugin and uploading it to your web server via your favorite FTP application. The WordPress codex contains instructions on how to do this here.

Updating

Automatic updates should work smoothly, but we recommend backing up your site.
sections.faq:
Can I use the plugin immediately after installing it?

You cannot use it until you apply and the review is completed.

Is there a free trial plan?

Not currently available.
We are considering this, but we have not decided when to start.

Is there a sample site to show what it will look like?

Although the site is only available in Japanese, the following is a sample site that is actually being used.
https://www.businessinsider.jp/
